posts.post_content:
This card just makes the game more fun. It puts the focus more on decks with creatures, and having more cards simply gives you more plays, it makes more things happen and makes the game feel more interactive. Unless this becomes part of a ridiculous combo deck, It should not be banned.   
  
Let us try it in legacy. It can't be as bad as Oath of Druids.

posts.post_content:
It IS part of some fairly easy combos, with [Arcbound worker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcbound worker).  
  
For example, [Soul Foundry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Foundry) the worker, and have two [Dross Scorpion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dross Scorpion)s and an [Ur-Golem's Eye](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ur-Golem's Eye). And that's all in its block.

Posted By: AXER (1/27/2010 2:11:30 AM)
Rating:

@axer

imagine this: you equip skullclamp to an artifact creature with 2 toughness, like an ornithopter, then sacrifice it for a shrapnel blast or any of the numerous cards that allow you to sacrifice an artifact. Imagine you also had a disciple of the vault out. For 2R an ornithopter, you draw two cards, and deal 6 damage to your opponent... Banhammer, so hard.

The above example doesn't even include half the other ridiculous stuff you can do with this in affinity (ravager) or a token deck.
